extendedInfo.description: Decked Drafter is the only app designed to help Magic: the Gathering players improve their draft and sealed deck skills, featuring a full draft simulator and expert strategy tips and card ratings. The perfect app for any draft or sealed deck fan, players can pick the Magic the Gathering expansion they would like to practice with, then launch into an event against seven other A.I. opponents. Open powerful cards from sets like Scars of Mirrodin and easily sort the contents by color, type and rarity. Then pick the best card for your deck and pass the rest to your opponent, working to build the most powerful deck at the table. Making the right draft pick is never easy, but for the first time ever you're not alone. Marlon Egolf, DraftMagic.com columnist and Grand Prix Boston 2009 Champion, provides a full strategy analysis for each Magic card contained within the app. Guest writers include Timothy Landale, Grand Prix Kansas City 2008 Champion and Darwin Kastle, Magic Pro Tour Hall of Famer. Improve your strategy skills with the help of these card ratings, which give a detailed look into the power level of each card. Their expert ratings are also used to tune the A.I. opponents, making Decked Drafter the closest experience to actually drafting with the pros, and an incredible strategy resource. After the draft is finished, build your deck using the simple interface, swapping cards around with a simple touch. Once the deck is built, test it in the draw simulator, email the list to your friends, or print out the decklist and assemble the deck with your own collection! Or access the handy card ratings and strategy tips at any time, making Decked Drafter the perfect pocket guide for your next draft event. Whether you're a seasoned drafter looking to refine your skills, or a Magic noob just learning how to play, this is the app for you! Learn from the pros by practicing with Decked Drafter, and you will be sure to dominate your next draft! Features - The only Magic the Gathering draft simulator available for the Android - Practice drafting against skilled virtual opponents, learning which cards to pick and why - Access ratings and strategy tips for every card on-the-fly Improve your draft and sealed deck skills! Drafting and Sealed Deck - Open virtual packs from actual Magic the Gathering expansions - Sort the contents of each pack by color, type or rarity - Easily pick and pass cards using the simple interface - Stop the action at any time to examine your picks, or sneak a peek at your opponent's - Having trouble? Check Marlon's strategy tips; or press the Suggest button! Deck Building - Add and remove cards from your deck with a simple touch - Easily sort draft picks by type, cost, color or name - Test draw from your deck to see how it performs - Email your decklist to your friends, or print it out and play in real life! - .Dec support lets you easily import your decklist to Decked Builder, Magic Online or Apprentice New to drafting? Learn the rules with the included guide! Notes: Comes complete with free access to the entire Scars of Mirrodin Block (Scars of Mirrodin, Mirrodin Besieged and New Phyrexia) as well as Magic 2012. We try to target about 100 words of writeup for each card on average, which results in about 60,000+ words of strategy tips for just Scars of Mirrodin Block alone.Additional expansions (Magic 2013, Innistrad Block) are available which improves the Decked Drafter A.I. so it can draft with this new set of cards, and of course, features full analysis and strategy tips for every card in the set.

reviews.title: Not working correctly
reviews.comment: Great when it works, lots of cards don\'t display. Reinstall didn\'t help.
reviews.author: adam l

reviews.title: Expensive and not truly random
reviews.comment: Must pay per block, and the packs seem to repeat the same commons more frequently.
reviews.author: Stephen J. Bush

reviews.title: Okay but...
reviews.comment: I\'d rather pay a flat fee and have updates with newer cards, but like others, you have to purchase newer card sets.
reviews.author: Shane Taylor

reviews.title: Sort by rating
reviews.comment: Love the app, please add sorting by rating on the card search interface.
reviews.author: Julio L R Monteiro

reviews.title: Nice interface
reviews.comment: It\'s a great app, but at the moment M14 shows only low quality images, there should be warnings on things missing before purchase
reviews.author: Alvaro Gonzalez

reviews.title: Please update M14
reviews.comment: Looking towards so big M14 drafts this week and would love it if it got added before then. Would pay instantly.
reviews.author: Alec Spencer

reviews.title: Great app
reviews.comment: Love this app, great way to kill some time at work.
reviews.author: Donald Warner

reviews.title: Like drafting with FNM newbs
reviews.comment: It\'s a good app,  but the card generator has the ability to pull some weird looking packs.  Also,  I never can tell what the comp drafts,  it just must have pick order assigned to a chart or something
reviews.author: Luke Wolkenhauer

reviews.title: 2014 draft had no commentary
reviews.comment: I payed for the 2014 draft with commentary and ratings.  When you download it you will find there is only a simple number system with no explanation of why cards are better than another.  In addition, the draft system doesn\'t seem to take into account how cards work with each other.  If these 2 things were fixed the app would be 5 star.
reviews.author: Luke de Andrade

reviews.title: Uh...M14 bug?!?
reviews.comment: Just bought M14 pack.. go to start a draft and it says \'Draft complete\' with 0 cards. Either I get my money back or we get a update with a fix!!! (Droid 3)
reviews.author: Graham Warwick

reviews.title: Charging for M14 witch wasn\'t available
reviews.comment: I tried to pay for M14 to prepare for the pre-release this weekend but I was disappointed. Content is not available yet but they still charged me!
reviews.author: Fang Yu Lee

reviews.title: Best app I\'ve found
reviews.comment: Best drafting application just wish the sets didn\'t cost so much.
reviews.author: Kyle Parisnen

reviews.comment: Awesome to learn how to draft with!
reviews.author: Robert Harris

reviews.title: 5 stars if I could figure out how to test my deck
reviews.comment: Can\'t figure out how to access the guide or test my deck out on the battle field
reviews.author: Richard Rivera

reviews.title: Great app to get acquainted with sets in limited format.
reviews.comment: I love this app. Its great to have a second opinion on cards and to practice drafting the set. Right now modern masters isnt loading properly but I\'m sure it\'ll get fixed. Spent many hours on this app already!
reviews.author: Brecht Van Rie

reviews.title: Outstanding!
reviews.comment: This app does everything I wanted it to and the commentary is helpful. The deck construction interface is the easiest I have seen. I wish Wizards had something similar for their weekly draft.
reviews.author: Grant Armstrong

reviews.title: Rating down after update
reviews.comment: I can only give 2 stars right now because after the last update the cards do not keep their casting cost correct. I have to keep switching between the Draft and Deck tabs to reset the correct costs, and the goldfish screen is simply broken because there is no tab switch fix there.
reviews.author: David Russell

reviews.title: Pretty good app
reviews.comment: The only downside to this app, is that the \"experts\" talk down on cards that excell in sealed formats. Some of the recommend picks are cards that I would never draft personally. Other than that, the UI is nice and the pack generation is as random as packs in real life.
reviews.author: Nathaniel Turcotte

reviews.title: Missing card images
reviews.comment: Awesome app for getting comfortable with pack cracking and card evaluation.  Some card images still missing for me.
reviews.author: Jesse Kerson

reviews.title: Gates II
reviews.comment: Now that the DGM pack generation seems fixed (now producing one land -- and that a guildgate in each pack) I wanted to re-rate this app. It\'s a great application that does a great job of improving your drafting skills and allowing you to explore the draft format before you go plunk down money at your local FNM.
reviews.author: Josh Jarman
